snippet: After decades of neglect, 20 acres of grassy hills and crumbling mansions in a corner of the Brooklyn Navy Yard that few New Yorkers have ever seen may get a new life.
abstract: Brooklyn Navy Yard Development Corp and developer Douglas C Steiner reach agreement to convert abandoned naval hospital and its grounds in Brooklyn Navy Yard into a media, technology and film hub that would create a 50-acre campus when connected to adjacent Steiner Studios; developers say the project, which would cost nearly $400 million and take 12 years to build, would create thousands of jobs for New Yorkers.
lead_paragraph: After decades of neglect, 20 acres of grassy hills and crumbling mansions in a corner of the Brooklyn Navy Yard that few New Yorkers have ever seen may get a new life.

headline.seo: Brooklyn Navy Yard Is Site of Proposed Media Campus
headline.main: From Weeds and Bricks to Media Hub in Brooklyn
headline.print_headline: Film and Technology Hub Planned in Brooklyn Navy Yard
